ClassInfo.author: JEAF Development Team
ClassInfo.description: Class contains message constants for JEAF Generator.

Message.defaultText: XSLT style sheet ''{0}'' can not be found within the applications class path.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if the style sheet that defines the transformation of the XML document containing error messages is not located within the applications class path.
Message.name: STYLESHEET_NOT_AVAILABLE

Message.defaultText: Unable to create directory ''{0}''.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if the generator can not create an output directory for a generated class.
Message.name: UNABLE_TO_CREATE_DIR

Message.defaultText: Unable to generate Java class ''{0}'' out of message resource ''{1}''.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if an exception occurs during the generation of the Java class using XSLT.
Message.name: UNABLE_TO_PERFORM_TRANSFORMATION

Message.defaultText: Unable to convert Excel workbook to message resource file. Class-Information is incomplete or invalid. Affected field ''{0}'' in file ''{1}''.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if an exception occurs during the generation of the Java class using XSLT.
Message.name: INVALID_CLASS_INFO

Message.defaultText: Unable to open Excel workbook ''{0}''. {1}
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown when an exception occurs when trying to open an Excel workbook.
Message.name: UNABLE_TO_OPEN_EXCEL_WORKBOOK

Message.defaultText: Unable to close Excel workbook ''{0}''. {1}
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown when an exception occurs when trying to close an Excel workbook.
Message.name: UNABLE_TO_CLOSE_EXCEL_WORKBOOK

Message.defaultText: Required sheet ''{0}'' inside Excel workbook ''{1}'' is missing. Please ensure that you use the right Excel template for message resources.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if class info is missing in the provided Excel workbook.
Message.name: CLASS_INFO_SHEET_MISSING

Message.defaultText: Unable to create new XML document.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a new XML document could not be created.
Message.name: UNABLE_TO_CREATE_XML_DOCUMENT

Message.defaultText: Excel workbook ''{0}'' does not contain any message data. Please ensure that the excel file contains at least one sheet with message data.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a new XML document could not be created.
Message.name: NO_MESSAGE_DATA_IN_WORKBOOK

Message.defaultText: Excel sheet ''{0}'' does not contain required column with name ''{1}''. Please ensure that you use the right Excel template for message resources.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a required column in message data is missing.
Message.name: INVALID_MESSAGE_DATA

Message.defaultText: Ignoring row ''{1}'' in Excel sheet ''{0}'' as it does not contain values for all required columns. The following fields are missing: {2}
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if values for one or more required fields are missing.
Message.name: IGNORING_ROW

Message.defaultText: Message-ID ''{0}'' is not unique. Excel sheet ''{1}'' contains this message ID even though it was already used before. Please ensure that every message ID is globally only used once.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a message ID is used multiple times.
Message.name: MESSAGE_ID_NOT_UNIQUE

Message.defaultText: Message-Name ''{0}'' is not unique. Excel sheet ''{1}'' contains this name even though it was already used before. Please ensure that every message name is only used once per Excel file.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a message name is used multiple times.
Message.name: MESSAGE_NAME_NOT_UNIQUE

Message.defaultText: Ignoring empty sheet ''{0}'' within Excel workbook.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a message name is used multiple times.
Message.name: IGNORING_EMPTY_SHEET

Message.defaultText: JEAF Generator expects JEAF Meta Model (JMM) revision ''{0}'' or higher. Please update your UML project to a newer version of JMM. Your current revision is: {1}
Message.description: JEAF Generator expects a specific version of the so called JEAF Meta Model (JMM). The JMM version that is used by your UML model seems to be outdated. Please upgrade to latest version of JMM.
Message.name: INVALID_JMM

Message.defaultText: «RESTOperation» ''{0}(...)'' has parameter type(s) ''{1}'' that are not compatible with OpenAPI. For further details please refer to FAQ entry #2.2 on https://anaptecs.atlassian.net/l/cp/ndmtZxvX"
Message.description: When working with OpenAPI and REST there are some restrictions concerning the data types that can be used in Java. This warning tells you that in a specific REST operation a incompatible parameter or return type is used. This will lead to an invalid request / response from an OpenAPI perspective.
Message.name: INCOMPATIBLE_OPENAPI_TYPE

Message.defaultText: '{0}'' seems to use file system references. This might lead to portabilty issues with the exported XMI files. For further details please refer to FAQ entry #2.1 on https://anaptecs.atlassian.net/l/cp/ndmtZxvX"
Message.description: Depending on how you export XMI files from your MagicDraw UML model, it might happen that the files contain information about file systems paths. This should not be an issue on the machine where you exported the files. However, it may lead to problems on other devices or your CI/CD infrastructure where file system paths might not be the same.
Message.name: LOCAL_FILE_PATH_IN_XMI

Message.defaultText: «BeanParam» ''{0}'' has propertie(s) ''{1}'' that are not comaptible with OpenAPI. For further details please refer to FAQ entry #2.2 on https://anaptecs.atlassian.net/l/cp/ndmtZxvX
Message.description: When working with OpenAPI and REST there are some restrictions concerning the data types that can be used in Java. This warning tells you that in a defined «BeanParam» at least one property uses an incompatible type. This will lead to an invalid request / response from an OpenAPI perspective.
Message.name: INCOMAPTIBLE_TYPE_IN_BEAN_PARAM

Message.defaultText: Resource path of «RESTResource» ''{0}'' must either start with ''/'' or might be not set at all.
Message.description: When defining the path of a REST resource then the path that is defined on the «RESTResource» (not «RESTOperation») must start with a '/'
Message.name: INVALID_REST_RESOURCE_PATH

Message.defaultText: Either «RESTResource» or «RESTOperation» must define a resource path for operation ''{0}(...)''
Message.description: The resource path of an «RESTOperation» is the combination of the path of the «RESTResource» and the «RESTOperation». However at least one of them has to be defined.
Message.name: NO_REST_RESOURCE_PATH

Message.defaultText: «RESTOperation» ''{0}(...)'' has an invalid path. Path of operation must not start with ''/''.
Message.description: The path of a «RESTOperation» must not start with '/'.
Message.name: INVALID_REST_OPERSTION_PATH

Message.defaultText: «RESTOperation» ''{0}(...)'' must define at least one HTTP-Method. Please correct your UML model.
Message.description: Each «RESTOperation» must define at least one HTTP method. If this message occurs then you have to fix your UML model.
Message.name: NO_HTTP_METHOD_DEFINED

Message.defaultText: «RESTOperation» uses http status code ''{0}'' which is not compatible with JAX-RS.
Message.description: The «RESTOperation» uses a HTTP status code that is not compatible with JAX-RS standard.
Message.name: INVALID_HTTP_STATUS_CODE

Message.defaultText: For «RESTOperation» ''{0}(...)'' no consumed media type is defined. The information can be defined either on the «RESTResource» or «RESTOperation».
Message.description: The supported consumed media types can either be defined on the «RESTResource» or on the «RESTOperation» but at least on one of them the information has to be defined.
Message.name: NO_CONSUMED_MEDIA_TYPE_DEFINED

Message.defaultText: For «RESTOperation» ''{0}(...)'' no produced media type is defined. The information can be defined either on the «RESTResource» or «RESTOperation».
Message.description: The produced media types can either be defined on the «RESTResource» or on the «RESTOperation» but at least on one of them the information has to be defined.
Message.name: NO_PRODUCED_MEDIA_TYPE_DEFINED

Message.defaultText: «RESTOperation» ''{0}(...)'' has input parameters without name. Please ensure that all input parameters are named.
Message.description: All input parameters of a «RESTOperation» must have a name. Please fix the issue in your UML model.
Message.name: REST_INPUT_PARAM_WITHOUT_NAME

Message.defaultText: «RESTOperation» ''{0}(...)'' has multiple request body parameters. Please ensure that there is not more than 1 request body for a REST operation. The following paramaters are treated as body parameters: {1}
Message.description: All input parameters that are not explicitly marked as «HeaderParam», «PathParam», «BeanParam» etc. are treated as body. However REST only supports one body per request. So please ensure that there is not more than 1 body per request.
Message.name: MULTIPLE_REQUEST_BODIES

Message.defaultText: «RESTOperation» ''{0}(...)'' has request body parameter even though its http method(s) ''{1}'' do(es) not allow it.
Message.description: A «RESTOperation» defines a body parameter, however it's HTTP method does not allow to use a body.
Message.name: REQUEST_BODY_NOT_ALLOWED

Message.defaultText: UML model contains has more than one global default error response.
Message.description: It's not allowed to have more than 1 global error response for an OpenAPI specification in an UML model.
Message.name: MORE_THAN_ONE_GLOBAL_ERROR_RESPONSE

Message.defaultText: «OpenAPIResponse» ''{0}'' needs to define exactly one reference to «OpenAPIType» that is used as response type.
Message.description: «OpenAPIResponse» types need to define exactly one response type
Message.name: TO_MANY_OPEN_API_RESPONSE_TYPES

Message.defaultText: «OpenAPIDataType» ''{0}'' must have excatly one property as long as they are not marked as composite data types.
Message.description: «OpenAPIDataType» must have 1 property as long as they are not modeled as composite data types.
Message.name: OPEN_API_DATA_TYPE_TOO_MANY_PROPERTIES

Message.defaultText: «OpenAPIDataType» ''{0}'' has property that is not a primitive.
Message.description: «OpenAPIDataType» must only have primitive types of properties, as long as they are not modeled as composite data types.
Message.name: OPEN_API_DATA_TYPE_ONLY_PRIMITIVES

Message.defaultText: «OpenAPIDataType» ''{0}'' must not have multivalued properties.
Message.description: «OpenAPIDataType» must not have multi valued properties, as long as they are not modeled as composite data types.
Message.name: OPEN_API_DATA_TYPE_NO_MULTIVALUED_PROPERTIES

Message.defaultText: «OpenAPIDataType» ''{0}'' must not have a parent class.
Message.description: «OpenAPIDataType» must not have parent classes.
Message.name: OPEN_API_DATA_TYPE_PARENT_NOT_SUPPORTED

Message.defaultText: «PathParam» ''{0}'' needs to be defined as required in the UML model.
Message.description: When defining a «PathParam» for a «RESTOperation» it is required that path parameters are required.
Message.name: PATH_PARAM_MUST_BE_REQUIRED

Message.defaultText: «PathParam» ''{0}'' must not be defined as multivalued in the UML model.
Message.description: «PathParam» must not be defined as multi valued in the UML model.
Message.name: PATH_PARAM_MUST_NOT_BE_MULTIVALUED

Message.defaultText: «{0}» ''{1}'' should have a documentation in the UML model.
Message.description: It is strongly recommended that the elements of the UML model have a meaningful documentation ;-)
Message.name: DOCUMENTATION_MISSING

Message.defaultText: «{0}» ''{1}'' must not have a parent class as it is marked to be a composite data type.
Message.description: When working with so called composite data types then inheritance is not supported for them.
Message.name: NO_PARENT_FOR_COMPOSITE_DATA_TYPES

Message.defaultText: «{0}» ''{1}'' has attribute(s) without a type. Please define a type for every attribute in the UML model.
Message.description: When modeling attributes in UML it is important that they also have a type. If a type is not defined then code generation is not possible.
Message.name: ATTRIBUTE_WITHOUT_TYPE

Message.defaultText: «{0}» ''{1}'' has attribute(s) or navigable associaiton end(s) without a name. Please define a name for them in the UML model.
Message.description: When modeling attributes and associations then it is required that they also have a type. If it is not defined then code generation is not possible.
Message.name: PROPERTY_WITHOUT_NAME

Message.defaultText: «JEAFService» ''{0}'' has method(s) with unsupported return type. Please ensure that all methods have a real return type and that no arrays of primitive types returned.
Message.description: When modeling operations of services it is required that they also have a return type. Also case "void" has to be defined in UML model. In addition multi valued primitive types are not supported as return types.
Message.name: INVALID_SERVICE_RETURN_TYPE

Message.defaultText: «{0}» ''{1}'' has method(s) with input parameters without name. Please ensure that all input parameters in every method are named in the UML model.
Message.description: When modeling parameters of operations it is required that they also have a name. If there are input parameters without a name then code generation is not possible.
Message.name: INPUT_PARAMS_WITHOUT_NAME

Message.defaultText: «{0}» ''{1}'' has method(s) without a return type. Please ensure that all methods have a return type.
Message.description: When modeling methods also a return type is required not only for methods that really return something but also in case of "void". If a method does not define a return type then code generation is not possible.
Message.name: METHOD_WITHOUT_RETURN_TYPE

Message.defaultText: «{0}» ''{1}'' has method(s) without a name. Please ensure that all methods have a name.
Message.description: When modeling method then they also have to have a name. Otherwise code generation is not possible.
Message.name: METHOD_WITHOUT_NAME

Message.defaultText: «{0}» ''{1}'' has method(s) where at least one parameter does not have a type. Please ensure that all parameters of all methods have a type.
Message.description: All parameters within the UML model need to have a type. Otherwise code generation is not possible.
Message.name: PARAM_WITHOUT_TYPE

Message.defaultText: «JEAFActivity» ''{0}'' must define exactly one return parameter. Activity has {1} return parameters.
Message.description: When modeling activities you have to ensure that each «JEAFActivity» does not have more than one return parameter.
Message.name: ONLY_ONE_RETURN_PARAM_PER_ACTIVITY

Message.defaultText: «JEAFComponent» ''{0}'' must have defined a layer.
Message.description: When modeling «JEAFComponents» you have to ensure that each component has defined a layer.
Message.name: NO_LAYER_DEFINED

Message.defaultText: «PersistentObject» ''{0}'' must have a class id > 0. Current value for class id is ''{1}''.
Message.description: Class that are modeled as «PersistentObject» must have a so called "class id" with a value greater zero.
Message.name: NO_VALID_CLASS_ID

Message.defaultText: Only association end ''{0}'' has applied sterotype «Role», but not on opposite end ''{1}''. Please ensure that stereotype «Role» is either applied on both ends or on none of them.
Message.description: When modeling persistent classes and their associations it is required that either both ends of an association have applied stereotype «Role» or none of them.
Message.name: STEREOTYPE_ROLE_NOT_SET_ON_BOTH_ENDS

Message.defaultText: Association ''{0} -> {1}'' must have a role name on the navigable association end.
Message.description: When modeling associations between classes then it is required that navigable associations ends have set a role name. Otherwise code generation is not possible.
Message.name: NO_ROLE_NAME_FOR_ASSOCIATION

Message.defaultText: «ObjectMapping» between properties ''{0}'' and ''{1}'' is invalid. {2}
Message.description: «ObjectMapping» is invalid according to the error message
Message.name: INVALID_OBJECT_MAPPING

Message.defaultText: Property ''{0}'' does not define a minimum value even though it uses Java Bean Validation «DecimalMin».
Message.description: Minimum value for for Java Bean Validation «DecimalMin» is missing.
Message.name: DECIMAL_MIN_VALUE_MISSING

Message.defaultText: Wrong target type ''{0}'' for Java Bean Validation «{1}». CharcterSequence or number is expected.
Message.description: For a specific Java Bean Validation a string-based or numeric target type is expected.
Message.name: WRONG_TARGET_TYPE_STRING_OR_NUMBER

Message.defaultText: Property ''{0}'' does not define a maximum value even though it uses Java Bean Validation «DecimalMax»."
Message.description: Maximum value for for Java Bean Validation «DecimalMax» is missing.
Message.name: DECIMAL_MAX_VALUE_MISSING

Message.defaultText: Wrong target type ''{0}'' for Java Bean Validation «{1}». Number is expected.
Message.description: For a specific Java Bean Validation a numeric target type is expected.
Message.name: WRONG_TARGET_TYPE_NUMBER

Message.defaultText: Property ''{0}'' has invalid number of integral digits for Java Bean Validation «Digits». Value must be zero or greater (integer = {1}).
Message.description: When working with Java Bean Validation «Digit» then the integral and fractional digits have to be defined properly.
Message.name: WRONG_INTEGER_DIGITS

Message.defaultText: Property ''{0}'' has invalid number of fractional digits for Java Bean Validation «Digits». Value must be zero or greater (fraction = {1}).
Message.description: When working with Java Bean Validation «Digit» then the integral and fractional digits have to be defined properly.
Message.name: WRONG_FRACTIONAL_DIGITS

Message.defaultText: Property ''{0}'' has invalid value. Minimum size for Java Bean Validation «Size» must be zero or greater (min = {1}).
Message.description: When working with Java Bean Validation «Size» then its minimal size has to be set properly.
Message.name: INVALID_SIZE_MIN

Message.defaultText: Property ''{0}'' has invalid value. Maximum size for Java Bean Validation «Size» must be zero or greater (max = {1}).
Message.description: When working with Java Bean Validation «Size» then its maximum size has to be set properly.
Message.name: INVALID_SIZE_MAX

Message.defaultText: Property ''{0}'' has invalid value. Maximum size for Java Bean Validation «Size» must be greater or equal as minimum size (min = {1} max = {2}).
Message.description: When working with Java Bean Validation «Size» maximum size has to be greater or equal to minimum size.
Message.name: INVALID_MAX_MIN_SIZE

Message.defaultText: Property ''{0}'' has invalid value. Either maximum or minimum size of Java Bean Validation «Size» must be set.
Message.description: When working with Java Bean Validation «Size» then at least minimum or maximum size has to be set.
Message.name: EITHER_MIN_OR_MAX_HAS_TO_BE_SET

Message.defaultText: Wrong target type ''{0}'' for Java Bean Validation «{1}». CharcterSequence, Collection or Map is expected.
Message.description: For a specific Java Bean Validation a string, collection and map target type is expected.
Message.name: WRONG_TYPE_CHAR_OR_CONTAINER

Message.defaultText: Property ''{0}'' has defined Java Bean Validation «Pattern» but no regexp pattern is defined in UML model.
Message.description: When working with Java Bean Validation «Pattern» then a regexp pattern has to be set.
Message.name: REGEXP_PATTERN_MISSING

Message.defaultText: Wrong target type ''{0}'' for Java Bean Validation «{1}». CharcterSequence is expected.
Message.description: For a specific Java Bean Validation a string target type is expected.
Message.name: WRONG_TYPE_CHAR

Message.defaultText: Wrong target type ''{0}'' for Java Bean Validation «{1}». Boolean is expected.
Message.description: For a specific Java Bean Validation a boolean target type is expected.
Message.name: WRONG_TYPE_BOOLEAN

Message.defaultText: Wrong target type ''{0}'' for Java Bean Validation «{1}». Date is expected.
Message.description: For a specific Java Bean Validation a date target type is expected.
Message.name: WRONG_TYPE_DATE

Message.defaultText: Model element ''{0}'' is marked to be ignored. Please ensure that this is still fine. Stereotype «Ignore» is intended to be a short term solution to exclude model elements.
Message.description: Special stereotype «Ignore» can be used to explicitly exclude model elements from code generation. However this mechanism is intended to be a workaround / short term solution and not a permanent one ;-). Proper solution to this is to clean up your UML model. That's why a warning is shown during code generation.
Message.name: IGNORED_ELEMENT

Message.defaultText: «RESTOperation» / «BeanParam» ''{0}'' defines a http header field ''{1}'' using parameter / property ''{2}''. According to ''https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/main/versions/3.0.3.md#parameterObject'' header fields with this name should not be added to an OpenAPI specification. This is not an issue. However the header field will not be present in the generated OpenAPI specification.
Message.description: OpenAPI standard defines that for whatever reason some header fields should not be mentioned in the OpenAPI specification e.g. ''Authorization'' header. However from an overall perspective it still might make sense to explicitly model them e.g. if these fields are still required in Java code. Putting it all together in very most cases this warning can be ignored and is only generated to emphasis that these headers did not get "forgotten" in generation of OpenAPI specification but are not added by intention. For further details please also refer to https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/main/versions/3.0.3.md#parameterObject
Message.name: IGNOREABLE_OPEN_API_HEADER_FOUND

Message.defaultText: Property ''{0}'' is marked as deprecated. However OpenAPI does not support to mark references to complex types as deprecated.
Message.description:
JEAF Generator supports to mark various elements in the UML model as deprecated. This information is also added to the generated code and OpenAPI specification. However, there are cases where OpenAPI does not allow to mark an element as deprecated. Namely this is the case for single valued references to other complex types like a 0..1 association to another object. In this case the generated Java code will still contain the deprecation but the OpenAPI specification will not have "deprecation: true". Instead only as comment inside the file is created.
Example: - # Property "xyz" is marked as deprecated. However OpenAPI does not support to mark references to complex types as deprecated.
Message.name: DEPRECATION_MARKING_NOT_ALLOWED

Message.defaultText: «RESTOperation» / «BeanParam» ''{0}'' defines a java.util.Collection for http header field ''{1}'' using parameter / property ''{2}''. However, JAX-RS sepcification only allows java.util.List, java.util.Set or java.util.SortedSet for headers but not java.util.Collection. Please fix your UML model so that either List, Set or SortedSet is used for multi valued header fields.
Message.description: JAX-RS specification only allows to use java.util.List, java.util.Set or java.util.SortedSet for header params but not java.util.Collection. Please fix your UML model so that either List, Set or SortedSet is used for multi valued header fields.
Message.name: COLLECTION_HEADER_PARAM_NOT_SUPPORTED

Message.defaultText: «RESTOperation» / «BeanParam» ''{0}'' defines a java.util.Collection for query param ''{1}'' using parameter / property ''{2}''. However, JAX-RS sepcification only allows java.util.List, java.util.Set or java.util.SortedSet for query params but not java.util.Collection. Please fix your UML model so that either List, Set or SortedSet is used for multi valued query params.
Message.description: JAX-RS specification only allows to use java.util.List, java.util.Set or java.util.SortedSet for query params but not java.util.Collection. Please fix your UML model so that either List, Set or SortedSet is used for multi valued query params.
Message.name: COLLECTION_QUERY_PARAM_NOT_SUPPORTED

Message.defaultText: «CompositeDataTypePublicField» property ''{0}'' is not of type String even though this is required.
Message.description: JEAF Generator supports to also make the public representation of a composite data type visible internally. To do so, a property has to be marked with stereotype «CompositeDataTypePublicField». In addition it is required that the property is of type String.
Message.name: COMPOSITE_DATA_TYPE_PUBLIC_FIELD_MUST_BE_STRING

Message.defaultText: Property ''{0}'' in your UML model makes use of soft links with custom generic types. Please make us of Maven Plugin configuration parameter ''javaGenericSoftLinkType'' / ''openAPIGenericSoftLinkType''.
Message.description: JEAF Generator supports so called soft links. They can be used to modularize your model without loosing information about real types. One possibility when using soft links is to use so called custom generic soft links. In this case you can define your own type that should be used to represent the soft link association. This type, however has to be configured in JEAF Generator Maven Plugin.
Message.name: CUSTOM_GENERIC_TYPE_NOT_CONFIGURED

Message.defaultText: «OpenAPIDataType» ''{0}'' is not immutable. At least one property is not marked as readonly in UML model.
Message.description: JEAF Generator supports so called OpenAPI Data Types. They can be used a strong type representation for basic types. For OpenAPI Data Types it is strongly recommended that they are immutable.
Message.name: OPEN_API_DATA_TYPE_NOT_IMMUTABLE

Message.defaultText: Model element ''{0}'' has applied stereotypes «POJO» and «ServiceObject». However both stereotypes can not be assigned to the same model element at the same time. Please fix your UML model.
Message.description: And model element can either be marked with stereotype «POJO» or «ServiceObject» but not both of them a the same time.
Message.name: EITHER_POJO_OR_SERVICE_OBJECT

Message.defaultText: Model element ''{0}'' is marked as deprecated. However at least one of the following information is not provided: "description, "since" or "removedWith"
Message.description: If a model element is marked as deprecated also a description, a "since" flag and the planned removal date of the deprecation should be provided so that consumers of the classes, services etc. can prepare.
Message.name: INCOMPLETE_DEPRECATION

Message.defaultText: Composite data type ''{0}'' does not have a public field name configured. Please fix UML model.
Message.description: If a model element is marked as composite data type then a name for the public field representation is required to be set in the model.
Message.name: NO_PUBLIC_FIELD_NAME_FOR_COMPOSITE_DATA_TYPE

Message.defaultText: Unable to generate equals() and hashCode() for class ''{0}''. The class has at least one non-transient bidirectional association.
Message.description: In case that a class has one or more non-transient bidirectional associations it is not possible to generate equals() and hashCode() as it requires some business knowledge to do so. If equals() and hashCode() are required for such a class then it has to be implemented manually.
Message.name: NO_EQUALS_FOR_BIDIRECTIONAL_ASSOCIATIONS

Message.defaultText: Property ''{0}'' of class ''{1}'' is modeled to be a «SoftLink». However, it belongs to a bidirectional association. Soft links can not be used for bidirectional association as this contradicts to their underlying concept of decoupling.
Message.description: JEAF Generator supports so called soft links. They can be used to modularize and decouple your application. Due to that it does not make sense to use them in combination with bidirectional associations.
Message.name: SOFTLINK_FOR_BIDIRECTIONAL_ASSOCIATION_NOT_SUPPORTED

Message.defaultText: Path param(s) ''{0}'' are defined in REST operation with path ''{1}'' but are not defined as parameters / bean parameters in the REST operation ''{2}''.
Message.description: A REST operation path defines one or more path params but not all of them are also present as parameters in the defined REST operation
Message.name: PATH_PARAMS_MISSING

Message.defaultText: REST operation ''{0}'' with REST path ''{1}'' has at least one path parameter that is not defined in its REST path. Dead parameters: {2}
Message.description: A REST operation defines path parameters that are not defined on the operations paths as parameters
Message.name: DEAD_PATH_PARAMS

Message.defaultText: No template binding parameter subsitution defined for class ''{0}''.
Message.description: JEAF Generator supports usage of so called Template Bindings in UML which are an equivalent to generics in Java. If a class makes usage of such a template binding then also a parameter substitution has to be defined in the UML model.
Message.name: INVALID_TEMPLATE_BINDING_NO_SUBST

Message.defaultText: Class ''{0}'' has more than one template binding in UML model.
Message.description: JEAF Generator supports usage of so called Template Bindings in UML which are an equivalent to generics in Java. However in UML it is possible to define more than one template binding per class. This is currently not supported by JEAF Generator.
Message.name: TOO_MANY_TEMPLATE_BINDINGS

Message.defaultText: The following mandatory slots / properties ''{0}'' are not defined for literal ''{1}'' of enumeration ''{2}''. Please make sure that you define values for all mandatory enum properties that do not have a default value.
Message.description: Enumerations might have mandatory properties without default values. If an enumeration literal is defined in the UML model and not all mandatory properties without default value are set, then this error message will be used.
Message.name: MANDATORY_ENUM_PROPERTIES_NOT_SET

Message.defaultText: Name ''{0}'' of {1} of ''{2}'' does not match to naming requirements of Java Language specification.
Message.description: Names of classes, enumerations, properties, parameters and operations must match to regular expression according to Java Language Specification.
Message.name: INVALID_IDENTIFIER_NAME

Message.defaultText: Property ''{0}'' of type ''{1}'' uses type ''{2}'' from OpenAPI specification ''{4}''. However in the UML model there is no dependency defined between OpenAPI specification ''{3}'' to ''{4}''. Please fix your UML model.
Message.description: JEAF Generator supports to split a model into several OpenAPI specifications. If in such a case one OpenAPI specification refers to the types of another one, then a dependency between OpenAPI specs has to be defined in the UML model. If you want you can disable this check using configuration parameter `disableOpenAPIDependencyChecks`. However, please be aware that not checking dependencies might lead to inconsistent or incorrect OpenAPI specifications.
Message.name: OPEN_API_SPEC_REFERENCE_MISSING

Message.defaultText: Property ''{0}'' of type ''{1}'' uses type ''{2}''. However ''{2}'' does not belong to any OpenAPI specification and thus can not be used.
Message.description: When working with OpenAPI specifications then all complex types that are used must belong to an OpenAPI specification. Please make sure that OpenAPI types only use basic types or other OpenAPI types that belong to an OpenAPI specification (same or referenced one).
Message.name: ORPHANED_OPEN_API_TYPE_USED

Message.defaultText: Properties ''generateBackwardCompatibility'' and ''successorName'' must only be set if stereotype «JEAFDeprecated» is applied on a property. Please fix your UML model.
Message.description: JEAF Generator support developers with special code generation for backward compatibility for Java properties. Due to that tagged value ''generateBackwardCompatibility'' and ''successorName'' of stereotype «JEAFDeprecated» can only be used for properties.
Message.name: BACKWARD_COMPATIBILITY_ONLY_APPLICABLE_FOR_PROPERTIES

Message.defaultText: Successor property with name ''{0}'' does not exist in class ''{1}'' nor any of ist parent classes. Please check the name of the successor property in tag ''successorName''. Available properties: {2}
Message.description: JEAF Generator support developers with special code generation for backward compatibility for Java properties. Therefore it is possible to define the successor of an already existing property. The name of the successor must match to a real property of the same class.
Message.name: SUCCESSOR_DOES_NOT_EXIST

Message.defaultText: Successor name for property ''{0}'' is not set in class ''{1}'' even though it is required for code generation of backward compatible Java code.
Message.description: JEAF Generator support developers with special code generation for backward compatibility for Java properties. Therefore it is possible to define the successor of an already existing property. The name of the successor must be set.
Message.name: SUCCESSOR_NOT_SET

Message.defaultText: Name for ''{0}'' annotation not defined in Maven configuration even though it should be generated. Please fix your Maven configuration by providing value for configuration parameter ''{1}''.
Message.description: JEAF Generator supports to generate NotNull / NotEmpty annotations based on the UML model information for properties and parameters. However, in Java there is no really default which annotatrion to use. So, JEAF Generator explicitly expects that the name of the annotation that should be used is defined in the Maven configuration.
Message.name: NOT_NULL_ANNOTATION_NAME_NOT_SET

Message.defaultText: Parameter ''{0}'' of method ''{1}'' has no type. Please define a type for every parameter in the UML model.
Message.description: When modeling parameters of methods in UML it is important that they also have a type. If a type is not defined then code generation is not possible.
Message.name: PARAMETER_WITHOUT_TYPE

Message.defaultText: Template binding of class ''{0}'' is broken. There is no concrete type mapping defined. Please make sure that for every template parameter substitution there also is a actual type defined in the UML model.
Message.description: JEAF Generator detected that there is a class with a broken template binding. Please make sure that for every template parameter substitution there also is a actual type defined in the UML model.
Message.name: BROKEN_TEMPLATE_BINDING
